infodynamics.measures.continuous

Interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ChannelCalculatorCommon
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorGaussian, ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov, ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo

    public interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
extends ChannelCalculatorCommon

    Interface for implementations of the conditional transfer entropy (conditional TE), which may be applied to univariate continuous time-series data. That is, it is applied to double[] data, indexed by time. See Schreiber below for the definition of transfer entropy, and Lizier et al (2008, 2010). for the definition of local transfer entropy and conditional TE, which is TE conditioned on one or more other potential sources. This is also called complete TE when all other causal sources are conditioned on.

    Usage of the child classes implementing this interface is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator;
    2. Set properties using setProperty(String, String) which may now include properties describing the source and destination embedding;
    3. Initialise the calculator using ChannelCalculatorCommon.initialise(), initialise(int) initialise(int, int, int), initialise(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int) or initialise(int, int, int, int, int, int[], int[], int[]);
    4. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using:
      • setObservations(double[], double[], double[]), setObservations(double[], double[], double[][]) or setObservations(double[], double[], double[][], boolean[], boolean[], boolean[][]) for calculations based on single time-series, OR
      • The following sequence:
        1. ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(), then
        2. One or more calls to addObservations(double[], double[], double[]), addObservations(double[], double[], double[][]), addObservations(double[], double[], double[], int, int) or addObservations(double[], double[], double[][], int, int), then
        3. ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations();
    5. Compute the required quantities, being one or more of:
      • the average conditional TE: ChannelCalculatorCommon.computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
      • the local TE values for these samples: ChannelCalculatorCommon.computeLocalOfPreviousObservations();
      • local TE values for a specific set of samples: computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[], double[], double[]) or computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[], double[], double[][]);
      • the distribution of MI values under the null hypothesis of no relationship between source and destination values: ChannelCalculatorCommon.computeSignificance(int) or ChannelCalculatorCommon.computeSignificance(int[][]).
    6. Return to step 2 or 3 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.

    References:

    • T. Schreiber, "Measuring information transfer", Physical Review Letters 85 (2) pp.461-464, 2000.
    • J. T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A. Zomaya, "Local information transfer as a spatiotemporal filter for complex systems" Physical Review E 77, 026110, 2008.
    • J. T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A. Zomaya, "Information modification and particle collisions in distributed computation" Chaos 20, 3, 037109 (2010).
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        void initialise(int k)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialise the calculator for re-use with new observations. A new history length k can be supplied here; all other parameters remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        k - destination history embedding length to be considered.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • initialise

        void initialise(int k,
              int l,
              int condEmbedDim)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialise the calculator for re-use with a single conditional variable, with the given destination, source and conditional embedding length, setting all embedding delays to 1, and the source-dest and conditional-dest delays to 1. All other parameters remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        k - Length of destination past history to consider
        l - length of source past history to consider
        condEmbedDim - embedding length for one conditional variable. Can be 0 if there are no conditional variables.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • initialise

        void initialise(int k,
              int k_tau,
              int l,
              int l_tau,
              int delay,
              int condEmbedDim,
              int cond_tau,
              int condDelay)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialise the calculator with all required parameters for embeddings and delays supplied, for a single conditional variable. All other parameters remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        k - Length of destination past history to consider
        k_tau - embedding delay for the destination variable
        l - length of source past history to consider
        l_tau - embedding delay for the source variable
        delay - time lag between last element of source and destination next value
        condEmbedDim - embedding lengths for one conditional variable. Can be 0 if there are no conditional variables.
        cond_tau - embedding delay for the conditional variable. Ignored if condEmbedDim == 0.
        condDelay - time lags between last element of the conditional variable and destination next value. Ignored if condEmbedDim == 0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • initialise

        void initialise(int k,
              int k_tau,
              int l,
              int l_tau,
              int delay,
              int[] condEmbedDims,
              int[] cond_taus,
              int[] condDelays)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialise the calculator with all required parameters for embeddings and delays supplied. All other parameters remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        k - Length of destination past history to consider
        k_tau - embedding delay for the destination variable
        l - length of source past history to consider
        l_tau - embedding delay for the source variable
        delay - time lag between last element of source and destination next value
        condEmbedDims - array of embedding lengths for each conditional variable. Can be an empty array or null if there are no conditional variables.
        cond_taus - array of embedding delays for the conditional variables. Must be same length as condEmbedDims array.
        condDelays - array of time lags between last element of each conditional variable and destination next value. Must be same length as condEmbedDims array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for inconsistent arguments, e.g. if array lengths differ between condEmbedDims, cond_taus and condDelays.

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
               java.lang.String propertyValue)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets properties for the conditional TE calculator. New property values are not guaranteed to take effect until the next call to an initialise method.

        Valid property names, and what their values should represent, include:

        • K_PROP_NAME -- destination history embedding length k (default value 1)
        • K_TAU_PROP_NAME -- embedding delay for the destination past history vector (default value 1)
        • L_PROP_NAME -- embedding length for the source past history vector (default value 1)
        • L_TAU_PROP_NAME -- embedding delay for the source past history vector (default value 1)
        • DELAY_PROP_NAME -- source-destination delay (default value is 1)
        • COND_EMBED_LENGTHS_PROP_NAME -- conditional variables embedding lengths as a comma separated integer list (default value "1" for a single variable)
        • COND_EMBED_DELAYS_PROP_NAME -- conditional variables embedding delays as a comma separated integer list (default value "1" for a single variable)
        • COND_DELAYS_PROP_NAME -- delays from the conditional variables to the destination as a comma separated integer list (default value "1" for a single variable)

        While COND_EMBED_LENGTHS_PROP_NAME, COND_EMBED_DELAYS_PROP_NAME and COND_DELAYS_PROP_NAME may be set separately and may therefore be arrays of different lengths, COND_EMBED_LENGTHS_PROP_NAME acts as the master from which we determine the number of conditional variables that we have, and we will check that they have the same lengths at the next initialisation.

        Note: further properties may be defined by child classes.

        Unknown property values are ignored.

        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface ChannelCalculatorCommon
        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        propertyValue - value of the property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem with the supplied value, or if the property is recognised but unsupported.

      • setObservations

        void setObservations(double[] source,
                   double[] destination,
                   double[][] conditionals)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the single time-series from which to compute the PDFs. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.
        Parameters:
        source - time-series of observations for the source variable.
        destination - time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 2D time-series array for the conditional variables (first index is time, second index is variable number). Length must match source.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setObservations

        void setObservations(double[] source,
                   double[] destination,
                   double[] conditionals)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the single time-series from which to compute the PDFs. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.
        Parameters:
        source - time-series of observations for the source variable.
        destination - time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 1D time series array for the conditional variables (indexed by time only) -- valid only if the calculator was initialised for a single conditional variable. Length must match source.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for example if the calculator was not initialised for a single conditional variable

      • addObservations

        void addObservations(double[] source,
                   double[] destination,
                   double[][] conditionals)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append/concatenate these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently.

        Note that the arrays source, destination and conditionals must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Parameters:
        source - time-series observations for the source variable
        destination - time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 2D time-series array for the conditional variables (first index is time, second index is variable number). Length must match source.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        void addObservations(double[] source,
                   double[] destination,
                   double[] conditionals)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append/concatenate these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently.

        Note that the arrays source, destination and conditionals must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Parameters:
        source - time-series observations for the source variable
        destination - time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 1D time series array for the conditional variables (indexed by time only) -- valid only if the calculator was initialised for a single conditional variable. Length must match source.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for example if the calculator was not initialised for a single conditional variable

      • addObservations

        void addObservations(double[] source,
                   double[] destination,
                   double[][] conditionals,
                   int startTime,
                   int numTimeSteps)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new sub-series of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append/concatenate these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently.

        Note that the arrays source, destination and conditionals must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Parameters:
        source - time-series observations for the source variable
        destination - time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 2D time-series array for the conditional variables (first index is time, second index is variable number). Length must match source.
        startTime - first time index to take observations on
        numTimeSteps - number of time steps to use
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        void addObservations(double[] source,
                   double[] destination,
                   double[] conditionals,
                   int startTime,
                   int numTimeSteps)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new sub-series of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append/concatenate these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently.

        Note that the arrays source, destination and conditionals must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Parameters:
        source - time-series observations for the source variable
        destination - time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 1D time-series array for the conditional variables (indexed by time only) -- valid only if the calculator was initialised for a single conditional variable. Length must match source.
        startTime - first time index to take observations on
        numTimeSteps - number of time steps to use
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for example if the calculator was not initialised for a single conditional variable

      • setObservations

        void setObservations(double[] source,
                   double[] destination,
                   double[][] conditionals,
                   boolean[] sourceValid,
                   boolean[] destValid,
                   boolean[][] conditionalsValid)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Sets the single set of observations to compute the PDFs from, but only where these observations are indicated to be valid. Cannot be called in conjunction with ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations()/#addObservations(double[], double[]) / ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations().

        Parameters:
        source - time-series observations for the source variable
        destination - time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 2D time-series array for the conditional variables (first index is time, second index is variable number). Length must match source.
        sourceValid - time-series (with time indices the same as source) indicating whether the source at that point is valid.
        destValid - time-series (with time indices the same as destination) indicating whether the destination at that point is valid.
        conditionalsValid - 2D time-series (with time indices the same as conditionals) indicating whether the conditional variables at that point are valid.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[] newSourceObservations,
                                             double[] newDestObservations,
                                             double[][] newCondObservations)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute local conditional transfer entropy values for the observations in the given time-series, using the PDFs computed from the previously supplied method calls.
        Parameters:
        newSourceObservations - new time-series observations for the source variable
        newDestObservations - new time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        newCondObservations - new 2D time-series array for the conditional variables (first index is time, second index is variable number). Length must match source.
        Returns:
        the time-series of local conditional TE values. First values will be set to zero until enough samples are accumulated to embed the variables as per the parameter settings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[] newSourceObservations,
                                             double[] newDestObservations,
                                             double[] newCondObservations)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute local conditional transfer entropy values for the observations in the given parameters, using the PDFs computed from the previously supplied method calls.
        Parameters:
        newSourceObservations - new time-series observations for the source variable
        newDestObservations - new time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        newCondObservations - new 1D time-series array for the conditional variables (indexed by time only) -- valid only if the calculator was initialised for a single conditional variable. Length must match source.
        Returns:
        the time-series of local conditional TE values. First values will be set to zero until enough samples are accumulated to embed the variables as per the parameter settings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for example if the calculator was not initialised for a single conditional variable
